com.mirasense.scanditsdk.interfaces
Interface ScanditSDK

All Known Implementing Classes:
LegacyPortraitScanditSDKBarcodePicker, ScanditSDKBarcodePicker
public interface ScanditSDK

Controls the barcode scanning process and camera access of the Scandit SDK. Copyright 2010 Mirasense. All rights reserved.

Method Summary

Method Detail

hasForwardFacingCamera

boolean hasForwardFacingCamera()

getOverlayView

ScanditSDKOverlay getOverlayView()

isScanning

boolean isScanning()
Returns true if the scanning is in progress.

Returns:
True if the recognition actively scans for barcodes.

startScanning

void startScanning()
Starts the scanning process, and triggers the loading and initialization of the recognition engine, in case this has not been done so far.

stopScanning

void stopScanning()
Stops the scanning process.

reset

void reset()
Resets the barcode scanner state. Can be used if a code has been recognized, the user is still close to the code, and the code should be recognized again, e.g. after the user pressed a button.

set1DScanningEnabled

void set1DScanningEnabled(boolean enabled)
Enables or disables the recognition of 1D codes.

Parameters:
enabled - Whether it should be enabled. Default is true.

set2DScanningEnabled

void set2DScanningEnabled(boolean enabled)
Enables or disables the recognition of 2D codes. (Note: 2D scanning is not supported by all Scandit SDK versions)

Parameters:
enabled - Whether it should be enabled. Default is true.

setEan13AndUpc12Enabled

void setEan13AndUpc12Enabled(boolean enabled)
Enables or disables the recognition of EAN13 and UPC12/UPCA codes.

Parameters:
enabled - Whether it should be enabled. Default is true.

setEan8Enabled

void setEan8Enabled(boolean enabled)
Enables or disables the recognition of EAN8 codes.

Parameters:
enabled - Whether it should be enabled. Default is true.

setUpceEnabled

void setUpceEnabled(boolean enabled)
Enables or disables the recognition of UPCE codes.

Parameters:
enabled - Whether it should be enabled. Default is true.

setCode39Enabled

void setCode39Enabled(boolean enabled)
Enables or disables the recognition of CODE39 codes.

Parameters:
enabled - Whether it should be enabled. Default is true.

setCode128Enabled

void setCode128Enabled(boolean enabled)
Enables or disables the recognition of CODE128 codes.

Parameters:
enabled - Whether it should be enabled. Default is true.

setItfEnabled

void setItfEnabled(boolean enabled)
Enables or disables the recognition of ITF codes.

Parameters:
enabled - Whether it should be enabled. Default is true.

setQrEnabled

void setQrEnabled(boolean enabled)
Enables or disables the recognition of QR codes.

Parameters:
enabled - Whether it should be enabled. Default is true.

setDataMatrixEnabled

void setDataMatrixEnabled(boolean enabled)
Enables or disables the recognition of Data Matrix codes.

Parameters:
enabled - Whether it should be enabled. Default is true.

setInverseRecognitionEnabled

void setInverseRecognitionEnabled(boolean enabled)
Enables the detection of white on black codes. This option currently only works on Data Matrix codes.

Parameters:
enabled - Whether it should be enabled. Default is false.

setMicroDataMatrixEnabled

void setMicroDataMatrixEnabled(boolean enabled)
Enables special settings to allow the recognition of very small Data Matrix codes. If this is not specifically needed, do not enable it as it uses considerable processing power. This setting automatically forces 2d recognition on every frame. This option only works on devices with Android 2.2 or higher, it does not cause issues with lower versions but simply doesn't work.

Parameters:
enabled - Whether it should be enabled. Default is false.

force2dRecognition

void force2dRecognition(boolean force)
Forces the engine to always run a 2d recognition, ignoring whether a 2d code was detected in the current frame.

Parameters:
force - Whether it should be forced. Default is false.

switchTorchOn

void switchTorchOn(boolean on)
Switches the torch on or off. If the torch button is enabled on the overlay, users can change this by clicking it.

Parameters:
on - Whether the torch should be on. Default is false.

setScanningHotSpot

void setScanningHotSpot(float x,
                        float y)
Changes the location of the spot where the recognition actively scans for barcodes. X and Y can be between 0 and 1, where 0/0 corresponds to the top left corner and 1/1 to the bottom right corner.

Parameters:
x - X position of recognition hot spot. Default is 0.5.
y - Y position of recognition hot spot. Default is 0.5.

setScanningHotSpotHeight

void setScanningHotSpotHeight(float height)
Changes the height of the spot where the recognition actively scans for barcodes. The height of the hot spot is given relative to the height of the screen and has to be between 0.0 and 0.5. Be aware that if the hot spot height is very large, the engine is forced to decrease the quality of the recognition to keep the speed at an acceptable level.

Parameters:
height - Relative height of the hot spot. Default is 0.25.

ignorePreviewAspectRatio

void ignorePreviewAspectRatio()
Normally the picker adjusts to the aspect ratio of the preview image. If this is called, it will no longer do this. Warning: If the aspect ratio is not kept, the camera feed may be stretched and no longer be a proper representation of what is recorded.

getMostRecentCameraPreviewImage

byte[] getMostRecentCameraPreviewImage()
Returns the last image returned by the Camera. (The image will be "landscape" oriented. It's dimensions can be accessed using getCameraPreviewImageWidth() and getCameraPreviewImageHeight().)

Returns:
Byte array containing the image information in the NV21 format (YCrCb format, which uses the NV21 encoding format) or null, in case no preview image has been obtained so far

getCameraPreviewImageOfFirstBarcodeRecognition

byte[] getCameraPreviewImageOfFirstBarcodeRecognition()
Returns the image data as obtained by the Camera Preview Callback method "onPreviewFrame" of the image, in which the bar code has been recognized for the first time. (The image will be "landscape" oriented. It's dimensions can be accessed using the getCameraPreviewImageWidth() and getCameraPreviewImageHeight() methods.)

Returns:
Byte array containing the image information in the NV21 format (YCrCb format, which uses the NV21 encoding format), or null, in case no barcode has been recognized since the recognition start or the last call of reset().

getCameraPreviewImageWidth

int getCameraPreviewImageWidth()
Returns the width of the preview images from the active camera.

Returns:
Preview image width.

getCameraPreviewImageHeight

int getCameraPreviewImageHeight()
Returns the height of the preview images from the active camera.

Returns:
Preview image height.

setProperty

void setProperty(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.Object value)
Sets a property. This function is for internal use only and any functionality that can be accessed through it can and will vanish without public notice from one version to the next. Do not call this function unless you specifically have to.

Parameters:
name - The property's name.
value - The property's value.

getProperty

java.lang.Object getProperty(java.lang.String name)
Gets a property. This function is for internal use only and any functionality that can be accessed through it can and will vanish without public notice from one version to the next. Do not call this function unless you specifically have to.

Parameters:
name - The property's name.
Returns:
The property's value.
